title: Cask: Port Charlotte 2004 Fresh Bourbon Barrel #893 / stored at Bruichladdich

details: Cask: Jura 2009 Barrel #103352 / stored at InvergordonThis Jura single malt was filled into single barrel #103352 in on 15th April 2009 and is currently maturing at a bonded warehouse at Invergordon.The Isle of Jura is one of the most isolated in the Hebridean archipelago, and by all logical accounts an unusual place to build a distillery. However, the historic site was re-opened in the 1960s, in part to provide jobs to what was a declining population at the time. The rebuilding of the distillery was backed by blenders Charles Mackinlay & Co, so like Bruichladdich, despite the island being covered in peat, it produced an un-peated spirit to meet the needs of their blends. details: Cask: Heaven Hill 2009 Barrel #3440943 / stored at Inveralmond BondThis Heaven Hill bourbon was filled into barrel #3440943 on December 31st 2009 and is currently maturing at a bonded warehouse in Inveralmond, Perth.Bernheim is a historic Kentucky distillery. It was established by the Bernheim Brothers in the late 19th century, before passing into the hands of the Schenley company following the repeal of Prohibition. When Schenley were bought over by United Distillers in 1987, the distillery was rebuilt as the new owners looked to consolidate their production to a single facility. When United Distillers became Diageo in 1997, the new parent company were interested in bourbon, and sold the distillery to Heaven Hill. Heaven Hill were established in 1935, but their long-serving Bardstown distillery was lost in a devastating fire in 1996. For most of the 20th century it was self-sufficient, malting its own barley using peat from Pitsligo, giving it a unique smoky character. In fact, in 1968 it was short-listed by then-owners DCL, to convert to heavily peated production in order to make up for a shortfall on Islay caused by a drought. In fact, in 1968 it was short-listed by then-owners DCL, to convert to heavily peated production in order to make up for a shortfall on Islay caused by a drought. In an odd twist of fate, the decision was instead made to re-open Brora for the job, and close Glen Garioch down. Morrison Bowmore then sprang to its rescue, restarting production in 1973. The maltings and distillery were closed down again by Beam Suntory in 1995, and only the latter resumed operations two years later, with contemporary Glen Garioch becoming an un-peated single malt. The new style was introduced in the form of an 8 year old distillery bottling in 2006.All relevant paperwork will accompany this purchase. title: 1 Crolly Irish Single Malt 2020 ex-Bourbon Cask 200 Litre / Cask in storage at Crolly Whiskey Distillery - Charity Lot
details: 1 Crolly Irish Single Malt 2020 ex-Bourbon Cask 200 Litre / Cask in storage at Crolly Whiskey DistilleryCrolly Whiskey Distillery was established in 2018 by locals Joe Devenney, Conor McMenamin and Kieran Davis, becoming the first legal producer of whiskey in Donegal for over 180 years.This is one of the early casks they filled and is currently stored in its on-site bonded warehouse at the distillery in West Donegal.  The highest bidder will become the owner of a 200 litre ex-bourbon cask filled with the finest Donegal double-distilled single malt spirit in November 2020. This will equate to approximately 325 bottles which the owner can personalise under the Crolly Whiskey brand.The distillery will look after the cask for you for the first 5 years, free of charge (after that a small annual insurance and maintenance fee of approximately £100 will apply, should the owner wish to mature the liquid for longer than 5 years).  The proud owner can look forward to owning a unique and undoubtedly very much sought-after authentic, hand-crafted, direct-fired traditional style Donegal whiskey.Please note that the cask owner may become liable to VAT and Duty at the prevailing time of bottling, but every assistance and guidance will be provided to the cask owner at that time.In Support of Beatson Cancer Charity"May we congratulate everybody who has in anyway contributed to the great work that Beatson execute every year in helping so many people along their way.  We here at the Crolly distillery are delighted to be in associated by way of donation and we wish the event every success. Go raibh maith agaibh agus ádh mór!"Click here to view some traditional music played at the distillery by Sheila and Clare Friel ,Caitlin Nic Gabhann ,Ciaran Maonaigh  and Cathal O Currain.This lot has been generously donated by the Crolly Whiskey Distillery n order to raise funds for The Beatson Cancer Charity. The lots are being spotlighted within our September 2021 Auction, which will run from Friday 24th September until Monday 4th October. You can find out more about The Beatson Cancer Charity by clicking here. clicking here.

title: 1 Lindores Abbey 2020 ex-Australian Muscat Hogshead 300 Litre / Bushfire Appeal Charity Cask to be filled by Buyer
details: 1 Lindores Abbey 2020 ex-Australian Muscat Hogshead 300 Litre  / Bushfire Appeal Charity Cask to be filled by BuyerWhisky Auctioneer is delighted to partner with local distillery, Lindores Abbey, to offer this once in a lifetime opportunity to not only own, but fill the first ever cask to be auctioned by the distillery. All proceeds raised by this lot will be donated to two Australian environmental charities to provide funds for those tragically affected by the recent wild fires in the country, they are the SA Bushfire Appeal and the Foundation for Rural & Regional Renewal. Please take the time to discover more about Lindores Abbey and this unique opportunity in our interactive long read.From distillery owner, Drew McKenzie Smith:"‘We have been horrified by the images of devastation coming from Australia. We have many Australian members of our Preservation Society who kindly contribute to the upkeep and conservation of our Abbey and its natural surroundings, so we feel compelled to do the same for them in their country’s time of need"Fittingly, the cask in question is a 300 Litre ex-Muscat hogshead from the De Bortoli winery of Victoria and New South Wales. Wine contributes a gross value of AUS$5.9bn to the Australian GDP, so the impact of the fires in areas where its vineyards are located (including some of those of De Bortoli) will be keenly felt in the years to come. The cask has been kindly donated by Nebb Whisky Barrels, a company that specialises in the sourcing of casks from Australia's best wineries.The winning bidder will be able to fill this cask themselves. They will travel to Lindores Abbey distillery to do so, where they will meet distillery manager, Gary Haggart, and enjoy a behind-the-scenes tour. Please note if the new owner is a UK revenue trader (business), they will need to be registered with HMRC and hold a WOWGR certificate.If they are a revenue trader outside the UK, they will need to have a Duty Representative in the UK (the Duty Rep would be registered with HMRC and there is usually an annual charge for their services). Please also note that we will provide the winning bidder's contact details to Lindores Abbey Distillery to arrange directly with them the filling of the cask and any associated administrative requirements.

details: Cask: Bruichladdich 2010 Rivesaltes Hogshead #2129 / stored at BruichladdichThis Bruichladdich Rivesaltes hogshead was filled on September 8th 2010 and is currently maturing at a bonded warehouse at Bruichladdich.Like its island neighbour Bunnahabhain distillery, Bruichladdich has traditionally been an un-peated single malt, mostly owing to its requirements by the blenders who owned it.
